reviews.review: Aşırı eğlenceli bir oyundu. Mantık içeriyor olması ve her bölümü düşündürerek çözdürmesi güzeldi.
portal 2 is AMAZING. If you havent played it yet buy it straight away
funny game to play with your friend

It's really fun and kinda hard, which makes it good. It's a lot of fun to play with friends and i recommend you at least do that. Also this games has made me realize that my IQ is way lower than i thought...

(This review is just about the campaign, not the editor/workshop/co-op/etc)

I love shooting a portal at the wrong spot because I literally can't see the platform I'm trying to make the portal appear next to and falling to my death once I go through it so I have to wait for the game to reload the entire level and set me back 30 seconds for a scripted section that also doesn't work properly so I have to wait another 30 seconds.

For 3/4 of the game I was having fun, but it suddenly devolved into these shitty esoteric puzzles with fifteen million conflicting mechanics that result in solutions that don't logically follow because they rely on features integrated into the convoluted systems instead of actual intuition (as in you have to know EVERY single thing a specific mechanic can do or can't do in every context, keeping in mind the non-deterministic nature of the Source engine and other sources of error like slightly misaligned portals and the garbage slow "smoothed" movement that feels more like I am a rhinoceros than a human). Wheatley constantly repeating the same unfunny voice line every time the game completely reloads the level because the physics in Source aren't deterministic and the light tunnel decided to not work this time does not help matters. This went from "fun game" to "math homework except with questions that randomly deviate from the laws of mathematics" in like 3 hours. Oh, and it's the Source engine, so bump the randomness up by a factor of 10. Did I mention that I spent an entire day trying to fix stuttering that made the game unplayable? If you want to know what it was, you need to have the game installed on an SSD or it'll just hang every 3 seconds for no reason. I don't know what it is about Valve games and being great most of the time except for one specific section where they just ran out of ideas or something, like the HL2 canals for example. Most of the latter quarter of this game is thinking of a fun out-of-the-box solution and it not even slightly working, but not because it wouldn't work in theory. Theoretically you could run yourself through a portal loop to gain momentum and then turn around mid-air to fire the exit portal on an angled wall to make a jump, but that of course doesn't work because 1. it's fun and 2. the momentum you end up with is basically random (thanks Source) and the angle is wrong anyway. The ACTUAL solution (that I didn't look up, by the way) is to place portals on two opposing walls to spray them with portal-conducting goop, alternating walls and gaining height each time, then using those to get to a catwalk, falling from it onto more portal goop and flying out of the angled plate. If you like looking up solutions in walkthroughs and scoffing as the guy basically exploits the game to win you can be my guest, but I don't like doing math homework. It's funny, because in Portal 1 when I got stuck I just stopped playing the game instead of ripping my hair out because the game was actively fucking with me and yelling in my ear constantly with this stupid 16-year-old-redditor-that-thinks-he's-really-funny sense of humor.
I loved the story, it was good in mechanics. I am a Half Life fan and recommend this to other Half Life fans that want more story in the Half Life universe.
